text:
Hey Jamie - apologies for the slow reply

Yes, I think I’m going to include some of this experience under another section. This has helped a lot in reminding me of the experience I have. Instead of just focusing on skills I know I have, I think I should include experience that ‘shows’ these skills too.

Good news! – I got shortlisted for an interview to be a VFX trainee with ScreenSkills :) it’s at their London office so I’m currently figuring out travel and money etc.

I am going to look over my application to them and figure out what they may want me to elaborate on. I also need two written references to take to the interview, so I am thinking of who best to ask, and to ask ASAP!

I was wondering if you have any tips on preparing for this interview? – It’s been a while since I’ve done a formal interview and it’s great that I’ve been given a chance, so I don’t want to mess it up.

Additionally, if you had any thoughts on references? – from their website, it says references can come from current and past employers, colleagues and/or a tutor or mentor. I am thinking of asking the person who produced my short film for channel 4. Then maybe for my 2nd reference, my old tutor at university. However, it’s been a long time since we have spoken, and I have progressed quite a bit since then.

Thank you for recommending this scheme to me :slightly_smiling_face: it feels like I’m making some real progress now and I’m excited!
